data.name: Isabell Baltic Porter
data.description: Our Baltic Porter is a complex yet drinkable winter warmer. Brewed in the style of a high-gravity porter, Baltic Porters were traditionally fermented at cold temperatures with a lager yeast, as is the German tradition, and have remained popular in the Baltic and Norse countries. Rich, roasty malt notes make up the aroma, with hints of brown sugar and raisin to complement in the flavor. The beer shows medium bitterness throughout, and the roasted cocoa, spice, and dark fruit notes linger into an eventual dry finish

style.name: Baltic-Style Porter
style.description: A true smooth cold-fermented and cold lagered beer, brewed with lager yeast. Black to very deep ruby/garnet in color. Overall, Baltic Porters have a very smooth lagered character with distinctive caramelized sugars, licorice and chocolate-like character of roasted malts and dark sugars. Roasted dark malts should not contribute bitterness, or astringent roast character. A low degree of smokiness from malt may be evident. Debitterized roast malts are best used for this style. Because of its alcoholic strength, aroma may include gentle (low) lager fruitiness (berries, grapes, plums, not banana; ale-like fruitiness from warm temperature fermentation is not appropriate), complex alcohols, cocoa-like, roast malt (and sometimes coffee-like roast barley, yet not bitter). Hop aroma is very low, though a hint of floral or sweet hop aroma can complement aromatics and flavor without dominance. Baltic Porters are not hop bitter dominated and expressed as low to medium-low. Baltic porters range from having medium to full body complemented with a medium-low to medium level of malty sweetness. No butterscotch-like diacetyl or sweet corn-like dimethylsulfide (DMS) should be apparent in aroma or flavor.

breweries.name: Kuhnhenn Brewing
breweries.description:
Founded in 1998, Kuhnhenn Brewing Company began as a homebrew supplies shop in the family's former hardware store while buildout on the brewery was taking place. 

The company has been producing countless award-winning beer, mead, and wine out of their 8-barrel brewery since 2001. In 2012, Kuhnhenn took home the Gold Medal at the World Beer Cup in the IPA category for their flagship offering, DRIPA, or Double Rice IPA.

The brewery  has expanded to capacity over the years, with only limited distribution in Michigan, New York City, and parts of Europe, in addition to taking part in festivals throughout the world. Construction is underway on a production brewery and second taproom in nearby Clinton Township, which will allow the brewery to get closer to meeting demand by increasing capacity more than 1500% overnight. 

Visit the brewery taproom for to-go sales of some of their award-winning products.

breweries.name: Bauhaus Brew Labs
breweries.description: Bauhaus Brew Labs is a family of musicians, scientists, artists and above all, beer lovers, aiming to reinvigorate the spirit of the family brewery. At Bauhaus, we take a unique look at classic German-inspired beer styles, skewed slightly by a sense of play and adventure. Our flavor-forward, sessionable beers are crafted to surprise and delight without taxing the palate.

breweries.name: Coronado Brewing Company
breweries.description:
When we opened the doors to our beach town brew pub on Coronado Island in
1996, we wanted it to be the kind of place where friends count enjoy great
beer, a good meal and a laid-back atmosphere.
Now, years later, our brewery’s a lot bigger and we’ve gotten a number of
awards. But we’re still following that same dream: brewing exceptionallly
balanced beer that’s authentically inspired by our West Coast roots. And
offering that experience to an ever-growing family that seeks an undeniable
coastal vibe, and shares our passion for great beer.
Welcome to Coronado Brewing Company. A Coastal Calling.

breweries.name: Cigar City Brewing
breweries.description: Cigar City Brewing was founded with two goals in mind. The first to make the world's best beer and the second to share with people near and far the fascinating culture and heritage of the Cigar City of Tampa. From its past as the world's largest cigar producer to its Latin roots and the many other diverse peoples that call it home, Tampa draws on many sources to develop its unique culture. At CCB we are fascinated by Tampa's history and suspect you will be too.

data.name: Kattegat
data.description: Our Baltic Porter has a clean profile with flavors reminiscent of rich, dark sugar, vinous and herbal notes, some dark fruit, and just enough dark chocolate and coffee to bring everything together. We are very excited to present our new interpretation of this old style to you, and we look forward to raising a glass with you soon.

breweries.name: Eventide Brewing
breweries.description:
Eventide is a start-up brewery in Atlanta, GA. It was founded on the idea that great beer doesn’t have to be complicated and good beer should be enjoyable. We are also focused on bringing sessionable craft beer to everyone. The biggest trend, and subsequent impediment, in craft/micro brewing is the almost obsessive need to make the biggest, hoppiest, strangest beer possible, which is great for advancing the boundaries of what can be done with beer but does not satisfy a daily thirst. We pride ourselves on making great beer, with all the flavor one could want, that people will actually want to drink whenever and with whatever. Again, great doesn’t have to be complicated.

Another of our fundamental ideas is that brewing is free, and should be open. So, with this in mind, we will share as many of our “secrets” as possible with everyone so that they too can make great beer at home. If you ever have questions please reach out, we are more than happy to share what we know! (Seriously, we will talk about brewing and all of it’s components for hours…love this stuff.)

data.name: Krysztoff
data.description:
In the coldest months of winter, we reach for comfort food…and comfort drink. With this in mind, we created Krysztoff, a big, bold, Baltic-style porter.

For this brew, we filled the mash-tun, twice, with the finest malted barley, crystal and chocolate malts. We then added Magnum and Mount Hood hops to the brew kettle to balance this elixir and give it a whisper of hop flavor. A fermentation as long and cold as a North Coast winter insured a smooth, rich, full-bodied beer.

Krysztoff is suited to be served in a snifter, allowing your hand to warm the contents to release the subtle aromatics and flavors of toffee, caramel, chocolate and raisins. At nearly 10% abv, this beer has a smooth, warming finish, and with age, look for port wine and sherry characteristics.

breweries.name: Custom Brewcrafters, Inc.
breweries.description:
Custom BrewCrafters introduced to the market in 1997 an innovative micro-brewing concept in which they have partnered with dozens of local restaurant and tavern owners in offering unique signature craft-brews custom designed for each establishment.

In addition to adding this new dimension to the Western New York beer market, Custom BrewCrafters opened a tasting room and gift shop at the brewery in Honeoye Falls, where we introduce the public to the many unique custom brews as well as educate them on craft beer and microbrewing.

data.name: Lake Monster
data.description:
Deep within the darkest reaches of our brewing consciousnesses lurks somethinig primordial, something terrifyingly magnificent.

The Lake Monster is not for the feint of heart. This exploratory series allows our brewers to push the boundaries of the brewer's art, creating beers that are bold, complex, and mystifying.


Unfiltered. Produced one batch at a time.

Abandon all hope ye who enter beer...

Half Acre Beer Co. is a brewing company in the Northcenter neighborhood of Chicago, IL. We built a brewery in the middle of the city where we brew small batch beers, and have a store & tasting area where we sample our beers and sell them to go in all package styles.

breweries.name: Toasted and Tapped Brewery and Restaurant Flowery Branch
breweries.nameShortDisplay: Toasted and Tapped Brewery and Restaurant Flowery Branch
breweries.description: Toasted and Tapped began as a challenge to a group of friends.  The challenge was to take our combined skills and create a brewpub that excels in providing tasty beers, inspired food, and excellent customer service.  After meeting in college, the group entered the work place to refine the skills required to create and operate a successful brewpub.  In January of 2010, with inspired council from family, Paul Coggins relocated to Georgia to focus the group on one purpose.  With the help of God, the group was charged to create the best dining experience for the community.  After many months of construction, permitting, setbacks, and discoveries; Toasted and Tapped opened its doors to the public on November 26th, 2010.  We at Toasted and Tapped are excited to offer the best food, beer, and service we can to the community which gives us so much.

data.name: Leviathan Baltic Porter
data.description: Leviathan Baltic Porter is a dark, strong beer of considerable complexity. Brewed with a highly alcohol-tolerant strain of lager yeast, it has a smooth, full flavor with dark fruit and licorice notes in the aroma. De-husked roasted malt lends a dark chocolate character without being sharp or harsh. Raw sugar and dark crystal malt give some raisin and molasses notes while East Kent Goldings hops make for a long, earthy finish.

breweries.name: Harpoon Brewery
breweries.description:
We started the Harpoon Brewery in 1986 because—like today—we loved beer and wanted more quality choices.  

There was only one problem: we were beer lovers, not brewers. We knew what we wanted to drink, but we needed some help actually brewing it. So we enlisted our first brewer, took over some warehouse space on the Boston waterfront, and began introducing fresh, local craft beer to Boston drinkers. We tried to do it in a way that captured the spirit of fun that had brought us to beer in the first place. From that warehouse, surrounded by fish companies on the docks of South Boston (neighboring what is now the Seaport District), we couldn’t imagine that craft brewing would become what it has today.  

We still remember our days on the other side of the bar, and have spent as much time spreading the joy of beer drinking as we have focusing on recipes, ingredients, and brewing equipment. Hopefully our sense of gratitude is reflected in both the quality of the beer and the spirit of fun and enjoyment surrounding our beer and breweries. We invite all of you to visit our Boston brewery, where it all began, and our beautiful brewery in Windsor, Vermont.

data.name: Limfjords Porter
data.description: Kom fra Thisted Bryghus i 1989 efter syv års eksperimenter. Navnet stammer fra Urban-bryggeriet i Aalborg, hvor brygmesteren fra Thisted Bryghus i slutningen af 70érne ”slog sine folder”. Her fik han første gang ”smag” for provinslivet og denne særlige øltype, som ofte i Thisted-regi betegnes som øllets gentleman. Navnet købtes efter Urban-bryggeriets lukning i 1986. Limfjords-Porteren ”kredsede” brygmesteren om frem til 1997, hvorefter han ikke mente længere at kunne forbedre produktet. Den rette blanding af maltene var opnået. Af usædvanlige ingredienser skal nævnes røgmalt og engelsk lakrids, der tilsammen giver en smagsmæssig balance på et lidt højere niveau end det sædvanligvis ses. Brygmesterens personlige favorit og ”hjertebarn”.

Roasted dark malts should not contribute bitterness, or astringent roast character. A low degree of smokiness from malt may be evident. Debitterized roast malts are best used for this style. Because of its alcoholic strength, aroma may include gentle (low) lager fruitiness (berries, grapes, plums, not banana; ale-like fruitiness from warm temperature fermentation is not appropriate), complex alcohols, cocoa-like, roast malt (and sometimes coffee-like roast barley, yet not bitter). Hop aroma is very low, though a hint of floral or sweet hop aroma can complement aromatics and flavor without dominance. Baltic Porters are not hop bitter dominated and expressed as low to medium-low. Baltic porters range from having medium to full body complemented with a medium-low to medium level of malty sweetness. No butterscotch-like diacetyl or sweet corn-like dimethylsulfide (DMS) should be apparent in aroma or flavor.

breweries.name: St. George Brewing Company
breweries.description: From humble beginnings as a "Brew on Premises" BOP establishment located in a store-front in a strip mall in Virginia Beach in 1991, B. A. Brewmeister has come of age as a brewery of craft beers with its 'brew haus' and 'celler' sharing a 10,000 square foot facility located at 204 Challenger Way in Hampton, Virginia. B.A. Brewmeister currently trades as The St. George Brewing Company & Olde Richmond Ale Company.

breweries.name: Portland Brewing
breweries.description:
The Brewery: At our brewery, you'll find a peculiar mix of overly obsessive individuals passionately creating something the civilized world simply can't live without: Great Beer. Without their valiant efforts, our world would slip into darkness.

The Beer: We seek to brew the very best craft beer out of Portland. With our unique touches on classic styles and our constant efforts to innovate and lead craft brewing into new, uncharted territories, even the most discerning palates will find something they love. Two year-round offerings, four seasonals and a series of four big-bottle beers will make sure of that.

The City: Considered to be the epicenter of the American craft brewing resurgence, Portland, Oregon is home to more breweries than any other city in America. Portland Brewing was one of the first craft brewers in the city and created Portland’s original Amber Ale. A favorite throughout the years, when Portlander’s say “Gimme a Mac’s” it’s understood they want the crisp, distinct flavor that MacTarnahan’s Amber Ale is known for.

data.name: Magpie Baltic Porter

breweries.name: Odin Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Odin Brewing embraces the exploratory spirit of the ancient Vikings.  We set sail in December 2009, during the height of a global economic storm, and have quickly become one of the fastest growing breweries in Washington, with our beer is now sacking and pillaging cities throughout Washington and British Columbia. We have taken a different tack than many new brewers, and rather than going for a number of very big, single batch beers, we are focused on food-friendly beers in a smaller lineup that is readily available year round. We realized a long time ago that food-friendly by no means needs to be less flavorful, and we actually add ingredients to widen the palate of our beers above and beyond their original styles.

To better integrate with a meal and make our beers more ‘sessionable’ in general, we utilize highly attenuating yeasts to dry out our beers to make them less sweet and filling, then replace that desired sweetness with an addition outside the norm, such as Juniper, Ginger or even Angelica. These ingredients are always kept at a level to avoid building a ‘spice beer’, and always present themselves as a unique and complementary addition. We also focus on extremely clean finishes, and use the entire recipe to build bittering rather than just using the hops to reduce lingering starchiness.

In the end, the true beauty of any flavor is in the eye (and mouth) of the beholder. Read about our beers here, then taste them at your local restaurant or store and judge for yourself if we have truly crafted ‘Great Beer Designed With Great Food In Mind’. We believe we have.

Awards: Silver Medal World Beer Cup 2006, Bronze Medal Colorado State Fair 2008, Gold Medal Colorado State Fair 2010

breweries.name: Slanted Rock Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Slanted Rock Brewing Company, LLC was founded in Meridian, Idaho on June 2011 by Bob Lonseth and Vincent Melchor. The Partners and additional investment from John E. MacCrisken has financed the start-up of this venture.

Slanted Rock plans to start Operations in Fall 2012 with a 15 BBL Brewhouse, 2-15BBL Fermenters, 1- 30BBL Fermenter, 1-15BBL Brite Tank and 1-30BBL Brite Tank. Production volume will be packaged in kegs initially with hopes of adding bottle or canning in the future.

Keg Sales will be self-distributed initially, with future distribution outside of Idaho. Retail Customers can buy kegs and pick-up direct from the location at a discounted keg price. Individuals can also purchase kegs in the following sizes: ½ BBL, 1/6 BBL

The brewery location will open a tap room where Slanted Rock and other selected craft brewers will be on tap. Sample flights, pints, half pints & growlers will be available for sale.

data.name: Pardubický Porter 19
data.description: The production of the traditional 19 beer – Pardubice Porter – began in 1891 by brewmaster Alois Šimonek, the creator of the original recipe according to which the beer has been brewed up to these days. Mixing fout carefully chosen types fo malts, maturation period three times longer than in conventional lagers, and other special production processes in manufacturing results in PORTER beer with its characteristic dark, almost black, thick foam and distinguished by a very delicate, sweet malt taste. Beer connoisseurs will appreciate chocolate and caramel tones with a subtle touch of cherry. Therefore PORTER is the only beer that is directly recommended to sweet dishes. www.porter.cz

data.name: Parrot in a Palm Tree Holiday Baltic Porter
data.nameDisplay: Parrot in a Palm Tree Holiday Baltic Porter (2010)
data.description: In San Diego, we’re not known for our partridges or pears but we can all relate to those noisy parrots and their relentless “caroling”. Parrot in a Palm Tree is a robust Baltic Porter brewed especially for the Holidays. Aged two months in San Pasqual Tawny Port barrels, the resulting brew isn’t for the birds. This winter warmer boasts a complex bouquet of dark fruits, espresso and chocolate, with hints of oak in its warming finish. Raise a glass to 2010 or save a bottle as this limited release will age with the best of them.

data.name: Pearl Street Porter
data.description:
Pearl Street Porter was brewed to commemorate Boulder’s 150th Anniversary.  This beer is dark and roasty, yet light on the palate.  Chocolatey aroma, subtle hops.  

Hops – Northern Brewer, East Kent Goldings, Czech Saaz

available.name: Seasonal
available.description: Available at the same time of year, every year.

style.name: Baltic-Style Porter
style.description: A true smooth cold-fermented and cold lagered beer, brewed with lager yeast. Black to very deep ruby/garnet in color. Overall, Baltic Porters have a very smooth lagered character with distinctive caramelized sugars, licorice and chocolate-like character of roasted malts and dark sugars. Roasted dark malts should not contribute bitterness, or astringent roast character. A low degree of smokiness from malt may be evident. Debitterized roast malts are best used for this style. Because of its alcoholic strength, aroma may include gentle (low) lager fruitiness (berries, grapes, plums, not banana; ale-like fruitiness from warm temperature fermentation is not appropriate), complex alcohols, cocoa-like, roast malt (and sometimes coffee-like roast barley, yet not bitter). Hop aroma is very low, though a hint of floral or sweet hop aroma can complement aromatics and flavor without dominance. Baltic Porters are not hop bitter dominated and expressed as low to medium-low. Baltic porters range from having medium to full body complemented with a medium-low to medium level of malty sweetness. No butterscotch-like diacetyl or sweet corn-like dimethylsulfide (DMS) should be apparent in aroma or flavor.

data.name: Perła Baltic Porter
data.description:
Perła Porter Bałtycki is obtained in bottom fermenting process. Its rich aged taste results from the perfectly estimated length of the conditioning process, which is almost nine months. Deep dark colour and creamy, thick white head distinct the beer from other beverages of this type available on the market. Its aroma is dominated by roasted malts, whereas its unique flavour results from original composition of such aromas as chocolate, caramel, and coffee. Natural sweetness is perfectly balanced with bitterness of two varieties of hops: Lublin and Marynka. Apart from water, yeast, and hop, Perła Porter Bałtycki consists of six different varieties of malt: pale ale, dark caramel, aromatic, pale caramel, and colouring malt.

Perła Porter Bałtycki can be served with dark chocolate, fruit, and desserts, especially the ones that contain pear.

The rich taste of Perła Porter Bałtycki can be enhanced not only by cooling the beverage to 8ᵒ – 12ᵒ C but also serving it in special beer glassware, perfectly in a tulip glass.

Two breweries (one in Lublin and one in Zwierzyniec) which were founded in 1846 Perła - Browary Lubelskie (Pearl - Lublin Brewery). It is available in UK, USA, Germany and Australia. Perla (Pils 5% ABV) was awarded a Bronze Medal at the International Beer Challenge BC 2010 awards in UK.

data.name: Pivo Baltic Porter
data.description:
A smooth medium-full bodied dark lager with a complex malty sweetness with a prominent roasty flavor and hints of dried dark fruit. Mouth-filling and smooth with a clean lager character and warming alcohol. Finishes slightly dry with hints of coffee and crème brûlée.

Baltic Porters are a very distant cousin to the original London porter. Like India Pale Ales, they originated as stronger versions of Porter brewed to withstand a long voyage east. When brewers in Poland and other Baltic states began brewing this style it was re-interpreted as a lager. Baltic porters are quite rich and strong and often made with lager yeast rather than the traditional ale variety.
data.foodPairings: Pivo Baltic Porter pairs very well with rich meat and poultry like lamb and duck. If you are in the mood for something spicy, try it with hot creole or Jamaican jerk. Also makes a great dessert beer with apple pie.

breweries.name: Amager Bryghus
breweries.description:
Our small microbrewery is located in a picturesque industrial neighbourhood near the Danish capital, Copenhagen, and the airport in the city of Taarnby. There is absolute no doubt that we run the safest brewing enterprise in the country as our premises used to be an air-raid shelter. Our premises have also been used for storing bibles, hence reigns an atmosphere of divine tranquillity only otherwise found in Belgian monasteries. Well...
 
Founders of the brewery are the two friends and dedicated home brewers Mr. Morten Valentin Lundsbak and Mr. Jacob Storm, who since the opening of the brewery have achieved diplomas of their skills as they have become Diploma Brewers at the Scandinavian School of Brewing.
 
It is our ambition to cater to all beer lovers - every time, which is why we only use pure ingredients during the brewing process. We make no shortcuts by using artificial additives to speed or help the processes. Furthermore, we have deliberately chosen neither to pasteurize nor filter our beer as we would like to preserve the best possible flavours and aromas.
 
We allow the beer to mature completely in the bottle before releasing it to the market. This process implies that a natural sediment may remain in the bottle. This sediment can easily be consumed, but if an aesthetic beer experience is desired, pour the beer gently into the glass without the sediment. And preferably use a high pour to get the full and frothy head as well as to release all the pleasant aromas from this well-brewed beer from Amager Bryghus.

data.name: Porter Baltique
data.description: Unlike typical porters, our Baltic Porter is brewed in the traditional style as a bottom-fermenting lager. The result is a luxuriously round, but robust, black beer with a mild bitterness. A special blend of roasted malts provides this porter with flavors and aromas of chocolate and coffee, and you’ll enjoy it’s subtle hints of cherry-smoked malt.

data.name: PorterCulture
data.description: PorterCulture is our interpretation of a Baltic style Porter.  The malt profile, based around German Pilsner and Munich with additions of Dehusked Carafa and Chocolate Wheat, is rich with flavors of dark chocolate, coffee, toasted bread and just a tiny hint of roast.  We dialed the hop profile back allow for all of the malts to shine through.  Fermented with our house lager yeast strain the beer has a robust, malty start with clean and crisp, lager-esque finish.

data.name: R&D: Sasquatch Legacy Baltic Porter
data.description: The Sasquatch Legacy Project, started by Walking Man Brewing and transitioned to Ninkasi Brewing, invites each year’s Glen Hay Falconer Scholarship recipients to come to our brewery and make a beer together. Proceeds from this beer will go to support the Glen Hay Falconer Foundation and the Northwest Legends Foundation, whose missions are to educate brewers and support the community in memory of our lost brewing friend, Glen Falconer. The 2012 scholarship recipients came together to create this year’s brew, including Anthony Stone of Boundary Bay Brewing Company, Jeremiah Boone of Anchorage Brewing Company, and Scott Caul a Corvallis-area home brewer. Using hop varietals preferred by Glen, we cheers this brew to his honor!

breweries.name: Ninkasi Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Established in 2006 by Jamie Floyd and Nikos Ridge, Ninkasi Brewing Company continues to brew independent craft beer from its Pacific Northwest home base in Eugene, Oregon. Named after the Sumerian Goddess of fermentation, the brewery operates under the core purpose: Perpetuate Better Living. Known for beers like Total Domination IPA, Tricerahops Double IPA, Dawn of the Red IRA, and cult favorites like Sleigh'r and Maiden the Shade, Ninkasi proudly serves quality craft beers while focusing on community involvement, art and culture. 

Learn more at www.ninkasibrewing.com.

data.name: Ragana
data.description: Baltic Porters were originally brewed for the long trip from England to the Baltic region. Ragana (Lithuanian for witch) is deep, dark and full of complex flavors. Full bodied with chocolate, coffee and a slight smokiness, English hops round out this wicked ale, adding a clean finish thanks to a colder fermentation.

breweries.name: Southern Prohibition Brewing
breweries.description: Southern Prohibition Brewing launched in April of 2013 with two simple goals: brew great beer and help make Mississippi a great place to live. Our 22,000 sq. ft. warehouse was a furniture showroom when originally constructed in 1941. After some renovations, the microbrewery in Downtown Hattiesburg houses a 20 barrel brewhouse. With three 60 barrel and four 40 barrel fermenters, Southern Prohibition currently has the capacity to produce 5,000 barrels a year.

breweries.name: Jackalope Brewing Company
breweries.description: Jackalope Brewing Company is owned by Bailey Spaulding and Robyn Virball, two young ingénues with an affection for beer. They met in September 2002 in the tiny Scottish village of St. Andrews, Scotland. Bailey was a Harvard student doing a semester abroad and Robyn was beginning undergrad at St. Andrews. They bonded over being put into the worst dorm for overseas orientation and teaching Danish people how to play beer pong. Though after three months Bailey went back to Cambridge, you can't break the bonds that are made when teaching Europeans drinking games and a true friendship was born. During the next eight years, they both graduated, Bailey went off to Vanderbilt Law School, and Robyn entered the working world, but both thought they were meant for much bigger and more alcoholic things.

data.description: Baltic porter brewed with Lager yeast and aged for 8 weeks. Instead of using black and Chocolate malts for color, we used de husked "carafa" to impart dark color, and reduce the amount of dark malt "bitterness"

breweries.name: Parkway Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Hidden in Salem’s industrial corridor of Kessler Mill Road, Parkway Brewing is poised to breathe new life into this forgotten thouroughfare by Mason Creek. With easy access from the Hanging Rock Battlefield Trail, Interstate 81, East Main Street and Routes 311 and 419, everyone can easily find their way to the rivers of tasty goodness we’ll be pouring on site! Come by on for a flight & a look around. And of course, you’ll want to take home a refillable Growler as a mouth-watering treat for the family or friends. Or you might just want to drink it all yourself!

We have loads of fun events planned, so check back here often. Bands, Food Trucks, Belly Dancing, "Body By Parkway Runners Club," Craft Nights, Cornhole Tourneys, you name it, it can happen HERE. You never know what you’ll find going on at Parkway Brewing, but fun will reign, so stop by & check us out. Only one rule: No Bad Vibes!

data.name: Red Thunder
data.description: Victory Brewing Company is known for melding traditional styles and unique concepts to produce the highest quality, full flavored beers. Red Thunder does just that. By aging their popular Baltic Thunder in once-used red wine barrels from Wente Vineyards, Victory Brewing Company created Red Thunder. The burnished cocoa creaminess of the Baltic-style porter is accented by the tannic dryness of the wood to produce a rich, fruity final product.

breweries.description: Having trained in Germany, we appreciate the artistic freedom we have here in the US. Here creativity is embraced by a fervent core of consumers and we are happy to serve that audience with our experience in traditional methods, selection of choice, often imported ingredients, and the best processing that technology can offer us. We relish the opportunity to please both ourselves and our audience with our flavorful creations.  We've invested more than our lives in this. Take a look at Victory Brewing Company's Beers.

data.name: Reverend Potter's Baltic Porter
data.description: Reverend Potter’s Baltic Porter is a full flavored dark lager which owes its heritage to the influence of the dark ales of England and cool fermented in the tradition of Eastern Europe. Generously hopped for balance, this beer hides its strength well, so watch out when imbibing near that warm New England fireplace on a cold eve.

available.name: Seasonal
available.description: Available at the same time of year, every year.

style.name: Baltic-Style Porter
style.description: A true smooth cold-fermented and cold lagered beer, brewed with lager yeast. Black to very deep ruby/garnet in color. Overall, Baltic Porters have a very smooth lagered character with distinctive caramelized sugars, licorice and chocolate-like character of roasted malts and dark sugars. Roasted dark malts should not contribute bitterness, or astringent roast character. A low degree of smokiness from malt may be evident. Debitterized roast malts are best used for this style. Because of its alcoholic strength, aroma may include gentle (low) lager fruitiness (berries, grapes, plums, not banana; ale-like fruitiness from warm temperature fermentation is not appropriate), complex alcohols, cocoa-like, roast malt (and sometimes coffee-like roast barley, yet not bitter). Hop aroma is very low, though a hint of floral or sweet hop aroma can complement aromatics and flavor without dominance. Baltic Porters are not hop bitter dominated and expressed as low to medium-low. Baltic porters range from having medium to full body complemented with a medium-low to medium level of malty sweetness. No butterscotch-like diacetyl or sweet corn-like dimethylsulfide (DMS) should be apparent in aroma or flavor.

breweries.name: The Prodigal Brewery
breweries.description: The Prodigal Brewery is an award winning brewery in the White Mountains of New Hampshire, specializing in German-inspired farmstead ales and lagers.

and Warrior hops. Hints of oak, cognac and
a light woodsy bitter finish.

breweries.name: Figure Eight Brewing
breweries.description:
Figure Eight Brewing is a small craft brewery located just an hour southeast of Chicago in Valparaiso, Indiana. We believe in making great beer and enjoying life to its fullest.

Our mission is to make great beer and share it. Utilizing the best ingredients while synthesizing classic and innovative brewing styles and techniques, riding on the edge of where beer has gone and where beer is going.

breweries.name: Gigantic Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Gigantic Brewing Company is an independent, crafty brewery located in the Southeast quadrant of the Peoples Republic of Portland. Brewer/Owners Ben Love and Van Havig are veterans of the Oregon brewing community.

At Gigantic we only do two things: make the best damn IPA in Portland, Oregon and produce seasonal, exciting, flavorful beers, most of which will be brewed only once. Our goal is simultaneously to create new interpretations of classic styles and to ignore those same style guidelines completely and brew whatever our creative natures produce.

data.name: Sea Legs
data.description: Complex and drinkable, Sea Legs delivers flavors of roasted malt and chocolate.  Sea Legs was aged in Bourbon Barrels for nearly 12 months adding toasted vanilla and bourbon notes to the flavor profile. This Medium-bodied Baltic Porter has a complex malt profile and mild hop bitterness. With a hidden ABV of 8%, Sea Legs is a siren of a beer.

breweries.name: Uinta Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Named after the only major east-west running mountain range located in the continental U.S., Uinta Brewing Company's journey began in 1993 with the reality that passion for craft beer and a hankering for the great outdoors could align in Salt Lake City, UT.
 
Built on an axis point that endorses sustainability, community involvement and innovation, their compass guides them on a path to admirable, consistent craft beer leading consumers to discover a brand with passion, personality and soul.  Precisely, GREAT BEER is Uinta's True North.

data.name: Shamans Porter
data.description: A Porter traditionally brewed in the baltic region. We use the finest ingredients including Munich, Chocolate, and Black Malts along with German Hops to create the smoothest Porter you have ever tasted. Shaman's Porter will thwart any tricksters or evil spirits!

breweries.name: Atwater Brewery
breweries.description: Atwater Block Brewery, founded in 1997, is housed in a 1916 factory warehouse located in Detroit's historic Rivertown district. Brewing relentlessly on our imported Kaspar Schultz system, we've ridden the wave of aggressive ales while holding true to our German roots through our traditional Lagers. With drinkability and tradition at heart, it's easy for us to "Drink Our Share and Sell the Rest"!
